channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-6628] Intermittent error in TriggerGeneralTest
item.description:
See in nightly regression test:

http://download.java.net/javadesktop/derby/request_5592869/javadb-task-3886181.html

where the relevant part of stacktrace is as follows:





junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Column value mismatch @ column 'TABLENAME', row 3:

    Expected: >T1<

    Found:    >SYSCHECKS<

	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.JDBC.assertRowInResultSet(JDBC.java:1303)

	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.JDBC.assertRowInResultSet(JDBC.java:1215)

	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.JDBC.assertFullResultSetMinion(JDBC.java:1102)

	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.JDBC.assertFullResultSet(JDBC.java:1025)

	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.JDBC.assertFullResultSet(JDBC.java:982)

	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.TriggerGeneralTest.testTriggersInGeneral(TriggerGeneralTest.java:874)

	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase.runBare(BaseTestCase.java:118)

	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.runBareOverridable(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:440)

	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.runBare(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:457)

{code }

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The assertion that fails has just done a query to check the lock in the lock table:

select type, mode, tablename from syscs_diag.lock_table order by tablename, type

and the assert finds an unexpected lock on SYSCHECKS. This table is accessed for CHECK constraints and for some reason is still lingering.
Attaching a patch that just ignores any locks on SYSCHECKS since they are not pertinent to what's being tested.

Do you think it's ok for the test to ignore locks on SYSDEPENDS and SYSSTATEMENTS too? See DERBY-5943 and DERBY-6281.

(I do wonder where the locks come from, though. Probably the compilation of the trigger action. But why aren't they released? Perhaps something made the nested transaction fail, so that the compilation happened in the main transaction?)
Yes, I was wondering about that too. But even so locks for these tables should have been released since we did an implicit commit just before (setAutoCommit(false)) in this case
I think the trigger could be compiled after setAutoCommit(false), when the delete statement is executed, since it's a delete trigger.
Right, so what would cause it's (re)compilation here? Do we only compile triggers lazily? Or do the inserts change statistics enough to trigger recompilation?

I tried to trace what happened in the delete statement, and I did not see the trigger being recompiled there; apparently it was already prepared (SPSDEscriptor#getPreparedStatement line 682 found a prepared statement already):

SPSDescriptor.getPreparedStatement:794	
SPSDescriptor.getPreparedStatement:655	
GenericTriggerExecutor.executeSPS:171	
GenericTriggerExecutor.executeWhenClauseAndAction:346	
RowTriggerExecutor.fireTrigger:113	
TriggerEventActivator.notifyEvent:272	
DeleteResultSet.fireAfterTriggers:468	
DeleteResultSet.open:157	
GenericPreparedStatement.executeStmt:470	
GenericPreparedStatement.execute:349	
EmbedStatement.executeStatement:1338	
EmbedStatement.execute:704	
EmbedStatement.executeLargeUpdate:181	
EmbedStatement.executeUpdate:170	
BaseJDBCTestCase.assertUpdateCount:1393	
TriggerGeneralTest.testTriggersInGeneral:857	
Hidden Source Calls	
Method.invoke:483	
Hidden Source Calls	
BaseTestCase.runBare:118	
BaseJDBCTestCase.runBareOverridable:440	
BaseJDBCTestCase.runBare:457	
Hidden Source Calls	
BaseTestSetup.run:57	
Hidden Source Calls	
SingleDerbyJunitTest.main:22

I have verified that at least, when I run the test standalone in the debugger, the trigger gets compiled as part of the trigger creation (line 840) , and it does not get recompiled at the delete statement triggering it (line 857).

I'm just speculating... The trigger might be recompiled because the preceding inserts into the T1 and PARENT tables causes the stale plan checking to decide that a recompilation is needed. Not sure why it would be intermittent in that case. Some interaction with the index statistics daemon, perhaps? Also, both the delete statement itself and the select statement against the diagnostic table would have to be compiled after setAutoCommit(false) has been called, and those compilations would probably need locks on the system tables. I don't see why the locks shouldn't be released, though, as compilation happens in a nested transaction that is committed separately.
Uploading a diagnostics patch that will dump the entire lock table in if we see the unexpected set of locks seen in this issue.

Commit 1606723 from Dag H. Wanvik in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1606723 ]

DERBY-6628 Intermittent error in TriggerGeneralTest

Patch derby-6628-more-diagnostics: a diagnostics patch that will dump
the entire lock table in if we see the unexpected set of locks seen in
this issue.
Unassigning myself from this issue until we get more information.
Failure seen again in the nightly run on the 10.11 branch on Windows_amd64_jdk9: http://download.java.net/javadesktop/derby/request_5595210/

The lock table we collected with the new diagnostics look like this:

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Column value mismatch @ column 'TABLENAME', row 3:
    Expected: >T1<
    Found:    >SYSSTATEMENTS<

    TYPE,MODE,TABLENAME
    ---- ---- ---------
   [ROW, X, PARENT]
   [TABLE, IX, PARENT]
   [ROW, X, SYSSTATEMENTS]
   [TABLE, IX, SYSSTATEMENTS]
   [ROW, X, T1]
   [TABLE, IX, T1]

The expected set of locks is:

{"ROW", "X", "PARENT"},
{"TABLE", "IX", "PARENT"},
{"ROW", "X", "T1"},
{"TABLE", "IX", "T1"}

so the locks on SYSSTATEMENTS are the extraneous ones, so it would seem (re)compilation locks are lingering.
I think we should just filter out these locks in this case since they do not really concern what's being tested here. Uploading derby-6628b.diff that adds a filter for all tables "like 'SYS%'".

Commit 1621215 from Dag H. Wanvik in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1621215 ]

DERBY-6628 Intermittent error in TriggerGeneralTest

Patch derby-6628b filters away any locks on system tables stemming
from (re)compilations of statements, since compilation locks is not of
primary interest in this test.

Talked to Knut about this patch a bit. We decided, instead of filering the unexpected system table locks, to retry the assert for the lock result set for a while to rule out slow, lingering (re)compilation locks (by the index statistics daemon?).

If the locks of the system tables hang around for a minute (max waiting time), something fishy is going on.

We'll run with this for a while, and if we don't see this issue again, close the issue.

Uploading derby-6628-2.diff. We'll run with this for a while, and if we don't see this issue again, close the issue.

Commit 1621223 from Dag H. Wanvik in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1621223 ]

DERBY-6628 Intermittent error in TriggerGeneralTest

Patch derby-6628-2.

We decided, instead of filering the unexpected system table locks, to
retry the assert for the lock result set for a while to rule out slow,
lingering (re)compilation locks (by the index statistics daemon?).

If the locks of the system tables hang around for a minute (max
waiting time), something fishy is going on.

We'll run with this for a while, and if we don't see this issue again,
close the issue.

Perhaps this should get backported to 10.11 at least. The test has not failed again in trunk, but failed on the 10.11 branch on Oct 10:
http://download.java.net/javadesktop/derby/request_5597471/:
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Column value mismatch @ column 'TABLENAME', row 3:
Expected: >T1<
Found: >SYSSTATEMENTS<

TYPE,MODE,TABLENAME
---- ---- ---------
[ROW, X, PARENT]
[TABLE, IX, PARENT]
[ROW, X, SYSSTATEMENTS]
[TABLE, IX, SYSSTATEMENTS]
[ROW, X, T1]
[TABLE, IX, T1]

at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase.newAssertionFailedError(BaseTestCase.java:1176)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.JDBC.addRsToReport(JDBC.java:1878)

Caused by: junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Column value mismatch @ column 'TABLENAME', row 3:

Found: >SYSSTATEMENTS<
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.JDBC.assertRowInResultSet(JDBC.java:1372)

Commit 1632674 from Myrna van Lunteren in branch 'code/branches/10.11'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1632674 ]

DERBY-6628; Intermittent error in TriggerGeneralTest
merge of revision 1621223 from trunk
Marking this as resolved. If the problem occurs again, we can reopen, or open a new issue.
